data.text:
Racism is the rejection of our common humanity. 

Fortunately, there are many ways YOU can #FightRacism to help build a world without discrimination and intolerance. 

Join @UNHumanRights in taking action today: https://t.co/U7LsPMaaRq https://t.co/tZvIu9A0yx

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, war or disaster at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/rtosk2ky10 via @Refugees https://t.co/064YcLpIz9

Adaptation to the impacts of the climate crisis helps make countries less vulnerable & more resilient by:

🚨 saving lives 
 🏙 keeping cities livable
📈 cutting business risks 
🏝 protecting coastlines & more. 

https://t.co/nNJQPOlUzJ #ClimateAction https://t.co/zyjjMEJG4W

Afghanistan: With majority of people in the country requiring humanitarian aid, @UNReliefChief hopeful that major pledging conference to be held on Monday will result in enough international support to help those in need. https://t.co/qGbXrn9xj6

"Imagine a world where every job is based on clean, renewable energy, where wind & solar power is even more abundant."

-- @UNEP Young Champion of the Earth @nzambimatee_ke explains the role of sustainable energy in building a better future. https://t.co/MWhGAd95BR #ClimateAction https://t.co/XbVXpcpmzm

The spread of misinformation is prolonging the pandemic. 

But there is something we can all do to stop the spread. 

#PledgetoPause before you share online and help save lives. https://t.co/qFqoh7loX2 https://t.co/melZRprdP8

From preventing a third world war to reducing extreme poverty, multilateralism has achieved enormous success over the past 75 years. 

The ideas & initiatives in @antonioguterres' Common Agenda build on these achievements for a better future. https://t.co/RfjiZufgut https://t.co/c2ZTHHsNmP

"We need deeper international cooperation to address the global health crisis, reduce poverty & inequality, achieve the #GoalGoals, and avert climate catastrophe."

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's #SouthSouthCooperation Day. https://t.co/eURfNXqjLW https://t.co/qOkdlMpaAK

"What I saw with the people I was working with - particularly with refugees, victims, or the survivors - is their resilience."

@UN_BiH's @MacdonaldIngrid shares what motivates her work & what keeps her "Awake At Night" with @MelissaFleming. 🎧 https://t.co/28IZteuKp1 https://t.co/1rjc0Zfi9m

Solidarity among countries of the South has offered concrete solutions to shared challenges, and can help achieve the #GlobalGoals. 

More on Sunday's Int'l Day for #SouthSouthCooperation: https://t.co/eURfNXqjLW https://t.co/qxPWMFK9Ca

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, people around the world are showing acts of solidarity and kindness. 

Check out out latest @TwitterMoments for inspiring examples: https://t.co/QV6ZwEgHuT

"We must make lying wrong again." 

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for global action to tackle disinformation and conspiracy theories, and to promote facts and science. https://t.co/NHi8lXodsk https://t.co/GuVyJPl6KG

Today we mark a somber day seared in the minds of millions of people around the world. 

20 years after the heinous attacks of 9/11, my thoughts are with the victims, survivors & families. 

-- @antonioguterres on the 20th anniversary of the September 11 attacks. https://t.co/8RIhxEw0Wg

📖 EDUCATE yourself on the many ways racism hurts society.
💭 REFLECT on concrete solutions to eradicate it.
🌱 CULTIVATE values of tolerance throughout your communities.

@UNHumanRights has more on how each of us can take action to #FightRacism: https://t.co/U7LsPMaaRq https://t.co/tf1NwFW86V

When Holocaust distortion is left unchallenged, it can lead to Holocaust denial, antisemitism, conspiracy myths & dangerous forms of nationalism.

We must #ProtectTheFacts & remember the victims to safeguard our future. https://t.co/uJ3Y1F7isI https://t.co/s8stb0HrX9

Humanity faces an urgent choice: breakdown or breakthrough. 

The decisions we take today could result in a future of perpetual crises, or a breakthrough to a better, more sustainable, peaceful future. 

Read more in @antonioguterres' Common Agenda:
https://t.co/RfjiZuwRT3 https://t.co/xXVQw8MNBa

Yemen: "The fighting must stop, the violence has to come to an end."

-- @OSE_Yemen Hans Grundberg tells Security Council that a peaceful Yemen is essential for the stability of the entire region.
https://t.co/FnvbXXPM2P

In his "Common Agenda", @antonioguterres lays out two scenarios for the future: 

- breakdown & perpetual crisis, or
- breakthrough to a more sustainable, safer world.

Read his vision for the future of global cooperation & effective multilateralism: https://t.co/RfjiZuwRT3

"We don’t need new multilateral bureaucracies. But we must make those we have, including the UN, more effective. We need multilateralism with teeth." 

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/NHi8lXodsk https://t.co/ZcHueWmDbz

"Afghan women are demanding the right to choose their own futures."

-- Messenger of Peace @Malala to Security Council as highest UN official in Afghanistan stresses the need for continued international engagement & unwavering commitment to the country.
https://t.co/f8DQO9r6NT

More than 700,000 people die by suicide each year.

Get more facts from @WHO on Friday's World #SuicidePrevention Day: https://t.co/mRMuhCmO6j https://t.co/HbbWL6LaqZ

"In our biggest shared test since the Second World War, humanity faces a stark & urgent choice: a breakdown or a breakthrough."

-- @antonioguterres shares his vision for effective multilateralism, calling on countries to address global issues together. https://t.co/RfjiZuwRT3 https://t.co/KMqbg9Mqvw

As hunger spikes in Haiti following devastating earthquake, @FAO calls for urgent funding to help restore the livelihoods of vulnerable rural families & avoid a worsening of the food crisis. 

https://t.co/kHGcU0r4d8

Friday is #SuicidePrevention Day.

Find out more about this public health problem & what you can do if you think someone is considering suicide: https://t.co/sbMUwdiJC2 via @WHO https://t.co/xH671kC5AE

Dag Hammarskjöld's wisdom & humanity, his unimpeachable integrity & single-minded devotion to duty set the highest standard for public service.

-- @antonioguterres commemorating the 60th anniversary of the former Secretary-General's death.
https://t.co/SawUtaTrbv

Suicide is a global public health issue that affects all ages, sexes & regions of the world.

More from @WHO on Friday's World #SuicidePrevention Day: https://t.co/mRMuhC5cHJ https://t.co/kKaDifIyCj

🎧 Take a listen, as @UNEP Goodwill Ambassador & SDG Advocate @deespeak & sustainable fashion advocate @AditiMayer talk about the links between the fashion industry, the climate crisis & colonialism. https://t.co/rJs6yu5gri

"I feel the world has ignored people with disabilities in the context of #COVID19." 

-- @eddiendopu on his experience of living with a disability during the crisis. 

#OnlyTogether can we be assured that no one is left behind amid the pandemic. https://t.co/GNaQLqWRGJ https://t.co/ZeG0BgWJpS

"The UN has supported Afghan girls’ education for decades. 
We won’t stop now."

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming explains why the UN will continue to advocate for education at all levels for Afghan women & girls. https://t.co/0ZPYgXRZDY

#TBT to the first session of the UN General Assembly in Central Hall, London. 

Later this month, world leaders will come together for the 76th session of the #UNGA, where they will seek solutions to some of the biggest problems facing humanity. https://t.co/xWc4QNQQ6l https://t.co/IRw3h6smqB

Every student & teacher should feel safe and protected at school. But for millions that is not a reality. 

On Thursday's #ProtectEducationFromAttack Day, join @UNESCO in stressing that schools should never be a target! https://t.co/jc0Iu1FYEp https://t.co/ZPr3fyXu7K

"Let us renew our commitment to end all nuclear tests, by anyone, anywhere."

-- @antonioguterres urges all countries to commit to a legally binding prohibition of nuclear tests. https://t.co/MG8jPou6Cq https://t.co/xuodoAxGgL

Attacks on schools, students & educators are attacks on children’s right to education & on their futures.

On Thursday's #ProtectEducationFromAttack Day, see how @UNESCO works to make education safe for everyone, everywhere: https://t.co/jc0Iu1FYEp https://t.co/vt2xw7nAc9

"Peace is possible. 
Peace is necessary.
Peace is the only pathway to a sustainable future."

-- @antonioguterres says he's looking forward to working with Security Council on shared goal of peace for all people in all countries. 
https://t.co/jRKSnTSPC5

More than 11,000 armed attacks against schools & universities were reported in the past 5 years alone.

Schools & universities should always be safe havens - #NotATarget. 

More on Thursday's #ProtectEducationFromAttack Day: https://t.co/jc0Iu1FYEp https://t.co/45f2Zs9b72

"Developed nations must deliver on the solidarity agenda. That means support to developing countries on vaccines, debt & liquidity, as well as climate finance." 

-- @antonioguterres stresses on Wednesday at event on #ClimateAction.
https://t.co/B133ebwPn1 https://t.co/CnsJrR7aX3

We live in an interconnected world. 
Disasters are interconnected. 
We need interconnected solutions. 

New @UNUniversity report shows cyclones, floods,  droughts & other disasters are interconnected and human activity is the common thread. https://t.co/snH2fqcGGZ https://t.co/dnK1DwEL2B

Literacy = Opportunity

Everyone has the right to learn how to read & write, but in many countries women & girls continue to be left behind.

On Wednesday's #LiteracyDay & every day, @UN_Women works to ensure equitable education for all. https://t.co/VTlJkIPx6u https://t.co/KG6lr1YGRm

"Everybody should be afforded the opportunity to dream & become everything their imagination desires." 

Disability activist & SDG advocate @eddiendopu talks about his work promoting a more inclusive world to @MelissaFleming on 'Awake At Night'. https://t.co/AUZYrlYFWW https://t.co/SRi6SNR1w0

With the rapid shift to distance learning amid #COVID19, the pandemic has magnified the inequalities in access to meaningful literacy learning opportunities.

On #LiteracyDay, @UNESCO is urging countries to close the digital divide. https://t.co/mSJkEd7UxJ https://t.co/AgUeM4ikVi

Basic digital skills have become essential to access life-saving information. Yet, over half of the world’s population lack those skills.

On Wednesday's #LiteracyDay, @UNESCO calls for increased efforts to expand literacy & digital skills for all. https://t.co/4d2GI9Wr3U https://t.co/MP4eL6PWOk

Everyone has the right to an education. It is the key to empower young people to claim their future. 

But on average, only 34% of refugees go to secondary school. 

More in the new 2021 @Refugees Education Report:
https://t.co/5TySI1cac9

Learning how to read & write should be a significant milestone for everyone. But millions of adults & youth lack basic literacy skills. 
 
On Wednesday's #LiteracyDay & every day, @UNESCO promotes literacy & learning for all: https://t.co/4d2GI9Wr3U https://t.co/KL0KrF6pci

As 1 in 3 people in Afghanistan suffer from acute food insecurity, UN launches $606 million appeal to provide assistance to nearly 11 million people.

Humanitarians warn basic services are collapsing and food and other lifesaving aid is about to run out. https://t.co/H32dJqv0Nh

What can you do to #BeatAirPollution? 
🚶‍♀️ Walk 
🚆 Take public transport
🚲 Cycle

More #ClimateAction tips from @UNEP on Tuesday's #WorldCleanAirDay: https://t.co/gzqhCxbNp2 https://t.co/smurEzsF0u

Clean air is a human right. 

Air pollution is a global public health emergency - and a ⁣preventable problem. 

On #WorldCleanAirDay, @UNEP explains how everyone can take transformative action to #BeatAirPollution: https://t.co/ojkDhy4JJi https://t.co/jIjB1cbIh2

Young climate activists are leading the way toward a better future for all.

@UNICEF introduces us to some of the youth taking #ClimateAction to protect our planet, including during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/9NkXruGEQ2

The pollution that is damaging our health is also driving the climate crisis. 

But air pollution can be solved. 

On #WorldCleanAirDay, I call on all countries to do more to improve air quality. 
- @antonioguterres 
https://t.co/4jdg7aHdlS

Despite the unprecedented expansion of social programs during the #COVID19 crisis, four billion people continue to lack social protection.

@ILO says the pandemic revealed & exacerbated social protection gaps between low- and high-income countries. https://t.co/iKBWSDcizs

🌳 Plant trees
🗑 Clean up trash
🚲 Commute without polluting

On Tuesday's #WorldCleanAirDay, @UNEP has tips on how you can help achieve healthy air for a healthy planet: https://t.co/mSa3ivrjd1 https://t.co/18Q2eotwKU

More women in peacekeeping = more perspectives & solutions in a crisis. 

Watch as women peacekeepers from Finland share their experience #ServingForPeace in leadership roles with @UNPeacekeeping. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ https://t.co/piQxwKCFH5

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, or war at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/rtosk22X9s via @Refugees https://t.co/XGJ0s9R3J4

Transforming food systems is critical for achieving the 17 #GlobalGoals.

Join the 17 day countdown to the @FoodSystems Summit where people from all over the world will come together to envision a better future for food. https://t.co/dVR0mk2DRi https://t.co/R74jMCWHwa

Yemen: Widespread conflict, severe economic decline, food insecurity & collapse of essential services continue to take an enormous toll on the population, but humanitarian aid may have to be reduced due to a serious lack of funding. https://t.co/cVjzxlVwOh

The Smurfs are teaming up with the UN's #ActNow campaign & the European Union to inspire people to help clean beaches & riverbanks around the world.

Join the #EUBeachCleanUp and take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/4i2kqgYQPL https://t.co/139dY1gBzy

Millions of people in the Asia and Pacific region are exposed to poor air quality due to sand and dust storms, with wide-ranging negative impacts on human health, energy, food security & more.

More from @UNESCAP: https://t.co/ibX6aKd77l https://t.co/NkzpIqnnrJ

Women play a critical role in achieving lasting peace around the world. 

Women in @UNPeacekeeping missions:
☑️ help reduce conflict,
☑️ serve as role models,
☑️ provide greater sense of security & more. 

https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh https://t.co/RqK9fKm6ij

Are you interested in applying for a job at the UN?

Learn from @UN_Careers how to create your application, prepare a cover letter & understand the job requirements:
https://t.co/VCeczcJBdS https://t.co/wmRZM9mcEZ

Due to the climate crisis, weather-related disasters have increased, but thanks to improved early warnings & disaster management, the number of deaths has decreased.

Warning systems help us adapt to climate change & build a more resilient future. https://t.co/hzTv9etJ64 via @WMO https://t.co/govoABTcD6

Change starts with you.  

On Sunday's International #CharityDay, get ideas for how you can help transform our world: https://t.co/gSTI42xgGG #GlobalGoals https://t.co/oXsZHYeAev

With 2 helicopters & 35 peacekeepers from Argentina, the flight unit of @UN_Cyprus conducts patrols along the buffer zone & provides logistical support to the @UNPeacekeeping mission in the country. 

More about the men & women #ServingForPeace in Cyprus: https://t.co/gqFf6Ll8ok https://t.co/3cdEhlJSsU

Charity can help alleviate humanitarian crises and human suffering. 

On Sunday's #CharityDay, find out how you can support the work of the UN: https://t.co/UbCEfo5gDF https://t.co/Vmt9Uf2gUc
On Sunday's International #CharityDay, we thank everyone who helps make the world a better place, especially amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/N7h11s3HB5 https://t.co/LYDOyLKK4N

I believe everyone is put in this world for a purpose, and my purpose is to impact the environment. 

-- @UNEP #YoungChamps winner @nzambimatee_ke & UN Goodwill Ambassador @EdwardNorton talk about #ClimateAction in our podcast "No Denying It". https://t.co/9Eee7wpX7p https://t.co/pMn9DsO0s4

Mother Teresa's selfless work helped inspire the creation of Sunday's #CharityDay. 

More here: https://t.co/N7h11s3HB5 https://t.co/UPnUBBRLdE

The number of people forced to flee due to conflict, war and human rights abuses has reached a record-breaking 82.4 million.

World leaders are being urged to act to reverse the trend of soaring displacement. https://t.co/dcALj55ZaS via @Refugees https://t.co/LohRIsm4yj

"People are afraid of disability. There is a resistance to talking about it within many communities around the world."

SDG Advocate @eddiendopu dedicated his life to ensuring that the voices of those at greatest risk of being left behind are being amplified & heard.

2021 marks the end of leaded petrol worldwide, which has contaminated air, dust, soil, drinking water and crops for decades.

@UNEP explains how this historic achievement will prevent 1.2 million premature deaths & save USD 2.45 trillion a year. https://t.co/ZTJgpLFe5T

What we share online can have consequences in the real world, especially amid the #COVID19 crisis.

Pause - and verify facts - before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7loX2 #PledgeToPause. https://t.co/vqTVacPeWS

More & more countries are committing to cut greenhouse gas emissions in order to limit global temperature rise and tackle the climate crisis.  

Find out where your country stands in the #RaceToZero emissions: https://t.co/fhnoPpZ7TC
 #ClimateAction https://t.co/I3K1IKrkiv

Sexual health requires a positive approach to sexuality and is fundamental to the overall health & well-being of individuals, couples & families.

More from @WHO on Saturday's World Sexual Health Day: https://t.co/Yt76gPxaDa

Healthy air 💨 🌫 

=

Healthy planet 🌎 🌍 🌏 

=

Healthy people 👩🏽‍🦰👨🏼‍🦳🧑🏼👨🏿

More from @UNEP ahead of next week's #WorldCleanAirDay: https://t.co/gzqhCxbNp2  #ClimateAction https://t.co/xHDYPHuddT

💊 Delivering medical equipment
💉 Promoting equitable access to vaccines
💬 Providing psychological support

See how the UN is working to overcome the #COVID19 crisis in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/gIgtxIGfBc

Lebanon: Poverty has drastically increased over the past year and now affects about 74% of the population.

Effective social protection measures are needed amid an unprecedented socioeconomic crisis, warns @UNESCWA.

https://t.co/pCVVo900Tv

#COVID19 lockdown & travel restrictions led to a dramatic, short-lived fall in pollution emissions, but improvements were not evenly spread & many parts of the world still fell short of air quality guidelines. 

More from @WMO: https://t.co/sMJ28YeMVu #ClimateAction https://t.co/MOHMxJtnR3

Tens of thousands of women, children & men have been forced to flee their homes in Afghanistan, often leaving everything behind.

@Refugees has more on the country's humanitarian emergency. https://t.co/td77QLf3vu https://t.co/DxjFVeEJ8W

"The women & girls of Afghanistan have earned the right to be heard, to take their place in society openly, as they've done behind the scenes for decades, if not centuries."

-- @unhumanrights deputy chief @NadaNashif on our podcast 'Awake At Night'. https://t.co/Jx1I5z0WJ7 https://t.co/LJN3IN3sBu

Take a listen 🎧, as UN Messenger of Peace @EdwardNorton & @UNEP #YoungChamps winner @nzambimatee_ke talk about ​rethinking how waste is managed & reused in the latest episode of our #ClimateAction podcast "No Denying It". https://t.co/9Eee7wHyvZ

UN peacekeepers from Finland are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/5cr3Iw1hDq

Over the past 50 years, weather, climate & water extremes have killed 115 people & cost USD $202 million on average per day.

The climate crisis has caused the number of disasters & economic losses to increase.  

We need urgent #ClimateAction now. https://t.co/MWhGAd95BR

Bodily autonomy - the power & agency to make choices about your own body & future - is a human right.

#StandUp4HumanRights and join @UNFPA and others around the world in saying: #MyBodyIsMyOwn. https://t.co/ne6A61DhQ2 https://t.co/qfbLh7VaKI

1/3 of all countries have no legally mandated outdoor air quality standards. 

Where such laws do exist, standards vary widely & often don't align with @WHO guidelines.

More on the urgent need to #BeatAirPollution from @UNEP ahead of #WorldCleanAirDay. ⬇️
https://t.co/5vyJ6c7elt

1 in 4 young women will have already experienced violence by an intimate partner by the time they reach their mid-20s.

@WHO study warns that #COVID19 has further increased women's exposure to violence. https://t.co/S2xluaFtAS https://t.co/U2KBXOmx9w

More women in peacekeeping = more perspectives & solutions in a crisis. 

Watch as women peacekeepers from Finland share their experience #ServingForPeace in leadership roles with @UNPeacekeeping. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ https://t.co/0v34C2fIsG

Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it: #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation — and the virus. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/Srsk0bP3pb

1 million plastic bottles are sold around the world per minute, adding to the plastic pollution that ends up in our landfills and oceans. 

We can all make a difference if we simply bring our own refillable bottle. 

Get more #ClimateAction tips here ➡ https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/0JsHS4emlE

A new data hub launched by @WHO aims to help countries better assess and respond to global disease threats in the wake of the #COVID19 pandemic.

 https://t.co/G6rdcy1P9v

Despite the unprecedented worldwide expansion of social protection during the #COVID19 crisis, more than 4 billion people around the world remain entirely unprotected.

Latest report from @ILO. https://t.co/j2ImvNL6aX

Due to the climate crisis, weather-related disasters have increased, but thanks to improved early warnings & disaster management, the number of deaths has decreased.

Warning systems help us adapt to climate change & build a more resilient future. https://t.co/hzTv9eLjXC via @WMO https://t.co/UIXSChNKSz

Watch as Birma makes an incredible journey to rural communities in Nepal to deliver lifesaving #COVID19 vaccines.

In 100+ countries, @UNICEF helps ensure vaccines are able to reach some of the world's most vulnerable people. https://t.co/wJPKbOenEV

https://t.co/On68YNCPs3

Ireland assumes the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of September.

Follow @irishmissionun for updates: https://t.co/5lmnXm3YP1 https://t.co/JisMztXkfI

As food prices in Afghanistan continue to rise, essential food is out of reach for many families.

@WFP is scaling up its assistance, but with needs escalating and winter looming, more funds are urgently needed to reach the most vulnerable. https://t.co/XXuHoO5Rjg https://t.co/84F4gV2M8L

"Now more than ever, Afghan children, women & men need the support & solidarity of the international community. The humanitarian system’s commitment to stay & deliver will not waver."

-- @antonioguterres as Afghanistan enters a new phase. 
https://t.co/In6istsjC3
